column5: I hope they have a speedy recovery. Jeez, how much can happen to one family???
Glad everyone came out with their lives. Hoping for a speedy recovery here!
Whew, good to hear that they are home and recovering.

Joey.... Thanx for the news however horrific...... Charmaine sent her an E-mail this morning as we were just notified of this accident through your post. We have been trying to reach either Chuck or Shell by phone with no luck at all. Most likely they are real occupied.......terrible, rotten news for this family. Please keep us all up to date Joey........again, thanx. PeteNCharmaine.
Sorry to hear, I just got back from Muskoka .... the fog was terrible up there for the past few days.  Hope everyone makes a full and speedy recovery !
my thoughts and prayers are sent

Hoping for a speedy recovery for all three of them! Glad to hear they are alive and on their way to mending.  The seat belt thing is a big one. My Oldest Daughter was involved in a serious wreck this past spring. We received the call that a mini van had tried to pass her on highway 10 on the soft shoulder doing over 100km per hour! The van rolled several times and threw three girls from the back seat out onto the road. The male driver and passenger were wearing seat belts, but the girls were not. To my knowledge one of the girls and the driver have not come out of a comma to this day.  My daughter was thankfully not injured and was only very shook up from what she saw. I know how it feels to go to the scene and see 4 air ambulances circling over head and not being able to reach our children. Very sad.  Godspeed in their recovery.

An  update on Justin...  Justin is still in the Toronto hospital.. they have done an MRI and have put a back brace on him.  They want to see if this will take enough pressure off his disks, to allow them to heal.  He will have to stay a couple more days and if all goes well, he'll be going home with an aprox. 4 month recovery period.  If they don't feel he is healing with this back brace, in the next couple days, he will have to have surgery...  It will be another couple days before we know anything more...  Dustin and Chandelle are still very sore and i think still in shock, but they started moving around a little yesterday.. and that can only be a good thing....  Thank you again to everyone for your thoughts and prayers....  Shelley....
Thanks for the update Shelley and hopefully the brace will be all Justin needs to fix him up.  Good to hear the others are coming along better now too.
Thanks Shelly, I'm hoping the brace does the job and he'll be up and about again in no time.  Glad to hear that Dustin and Chandelle are slowly on the mend as well.  Maureen

UPDATE....  Justin IS HOME,      just a short while ago.. but he's home.. in a back brace still and hopefully it will continue that way until he is FULLY healed ....  Thanks again to everyone for their thoughts and prayers...  Shelley
That's GREAT new Shelly!    Here's to a speedy recovery now.
Wonderful news Shelley !!
Great news Shelley.  I'm so glad to hear that.  Joey
That is really great news. Wishing them all a smooth recovery!

My son and his girlfriend were brought home this morning... They are banged up pretty good and will take some time to heal, but they are alive, and they will heal... The police say they are very lucky to have survived such a terrible accident and come out of it as well as they did.  Justin, the friend in the back seat, is still in hospital and being transferred to St. Mike’s in Toronto to see some specialist’s for his back.  He has cracked vertebrae and they are worried it is moving towards his spine.  He will more than likely have to have back surgery.  But he too is alive and thankful for that…He seems to be in good spirits, and we are keeping close contact with his mother.  It surely was a terrifying experience for us parents that made it to the scene…. And something I hope I never have to see again.  We are all so VERY thankful that we still have our children…. It could have been so much worse....  Thank you to everyone for your well wishes and thoughts....  Shelley…
I'm sorry to hear of such a horrible accident. I wish both boys all the best and hope they can be back to their normal selves soon.

Oh NOooo I did not want to read such terrible news.  Shelley and Chuck our family will pray for your family and please let us know how they progress to recovery.  Regards, Sam, Laurie, Andrew and Hunter
im glad the 2 of them are ok and back home!  i hope for the friend they can fix him up and he can be back to normal as soona s possible.  My thoughts are with your family!
Holy Crap!  banged up but alive is good!! Ill be thinking of you guys!
sorry to hear. All our best to your family
Glad to hear two out of three are home and going to be OK, Justin will be well looked after in Toronto...I'll be keeping the good thoughts rollin  Maureen

Getting T-boned in the fog . . .     and living to tell about it . . . .     sounds like they were in a good solid vehicle. Hope they heal okay . . .   and STILL get to ice fish before the season's over. Best of lucck to ALL of them!
All my best Shelly.  I'll be thinking of your family.
Wishing a full and quick recovery to all involved..

Oh no, I just got home and this is the 1st post I saw.  Chuck & Shelly, I'm really sorry to hear of more terrible news for your family and best wishes for a speedy recovery for everyone......... Please keep us informed.
Best of luck in their recovery.
Hope they all get better soon  rob

My thoughts are with you and your son as well as the others involved, Chuck and Shelley... Glad to hear their conditions are stable and are on the road to a hopefully speedy and uninterrupted recovery  Bill
Shelley and Chuck, sorry to hear about the accident and wish speedy recovery to all injured.  Ice Fisherman
glad to hear that two are home, i hope they can get through this quickly and heal up fast.  jason

we too are sorry to here the bad news but keep thinking positive as you said they are alive and home now except for Justin whom  will be home in time this brings up the importance of everyone wearing there seat belt!!! lets hope the rest of the year gets better.    Dann & Kelly
My thoughts and Prayers go out to you Shelley! Here's to a speedy recovery for your family.
Hope all involved make a speedy recovery.......  Chris

Wow...that's terrible news!  Sounds like someone was looking out for them all though from your description.  I'm very happy to hear that things worked out as good as they could have in this situation.  Here's to a speedy recovery!
All the best to you and the other family involved. The other driver must feel terrible about the accident.
Good to hear your Kid(s) are OK!
Done.
Hope everything turns out alright thoughts and prayers the Martins.
Hope all the kids have a speedy recovery.

Shelley's son has been in terrible car accident.  It happened yesterday in the fog in Innisfil.  Their vehicle was t-boned at an intersection and then rolled several times into the ditch.  I have just spoken with her again today and she would like our prayers and good thoughts for her son, his girlfriend Chandell and their friend Justin.  Shelley's son has a broken knee and ribs and they are worried about his lungs being punctured, Chandell has a broken leg, a concussion and stitches to her right side, which was pretty beat up, and their friend Justin, who was a backseat passenger (and was not wearing a seatbelt) was thrown around the vehicle and may have a broken back.  He was unconsious at the scene.  I will update you as I hear from her.  The accident was on the 6 o'clock news last night on A-Channel.  There is a snippet of it on their website for anyone interested.  Joey
sorry to hear this I saw it on the news  I hope all turns out well
When it rains it pours for these folks. Saw it on the new last night as well.  We're pulling for everyone to come thru fine Shelley!  Wayne and Leah
Wishing everyone gets well soon.
So sorry to hear this.  Hope all turns OK for you Shelley.  Jim
Best wishes Shelley and family!
Wow! Terrible news. Wishing for a speedy recovery for all involved.  Sincerely, 1leg
sorry to hear,thoughts go out and hope it works out.
I'm pulling for you.  My thoughts and prayers going out to all.
Very sorry to hear, hope for the best.
That's terrible news! I hope everybody involved makes a speedy recovery.
Good Lord, truly hope everyone's okay. Prayer sent.
Here's to a speedy recovery for all involved.  Stay strong Shelley.
Our thoughts and prayers go out to the families for speedy recoveries!!
Best wishes for a full recovery..
Shelley, you and your family will me on our minds.  As with all other members here, best wishes for a problem free and quick recovery.
Our prayers are for Shelley and Chuck's peace of mind in this situation and for a speedy recovery for all three kids...  Maribeth and Beans...
My thoughts are for the best outcome keep your head up
Truly sad to read this... my prayers go out to Big Chevy and Lady Walleye at this time. HH
What the H3LL more can happen to this family.  Very tragic. Shelly and Chuck my thoughts are with you and I hope your son and his friends have a speedy recovery.  John and Diane Ross
our thoughts and prayers go out to you shelley and chuck...hope all involved have a speedy recovery..peter and susan
Best wishes to you and your family
This is just wrong.  Prayers are with you and all those involved.

I am so sad to hear that news, you really didn't need more things on your plate to worry about but you are a strong family and we will pray for a full and speedy recovery for all involved. Keep us posted and know we are thinking of you and the kids.
Heres hoping for a speedy recovery with no lasting side effects.
